column2: This aqueduct supplies public baths, latrines, fountains, mines, mills, farms, gardens and private households.
Aqueducts bring water from outside sources into cities and towns. A clean source of water can help §YResist Disease§! and benefit one's §YHealth§!.
A style pioneered by the Ancient Romans, this arch stands tribute to the military might of its builder.
Used to commemorate §YPrestigious§! leaders or events such as the founding of new colonies, a death in a noble family or the accession of a new liege.
This grandiose bridge makes an easier crossing of the great river.
A fine example of civil engineering, a bridge greatly improves §YMovement Speed§! and can help people cross previously unsurmountable terrain.
This gigantic colossus stands guard over the harbour mouth, overseeing all who come and go.
Patterned after the fabled guardian of Rhodes, this gigantic statue defends its charge against §YSieges§!.
This market cross defines a market square in towns, where historically the right to hold a regular market or fair was granted by the monarch, a bishop or a baron.
A market cross is a structure used to denote a market square in towns. These markets increase §YLocal Tax§! and greatly aid the §YEconomy§Y.
This ominous monolith stands watch over nobles and commoners alike.
A §YFearful§! black obelisk of foreign design that serves as a reminder of the builders power and §YPrestige§!.
Subterranean pipes and deep channels that feed the irrigation ditches in adjacent farmland.
Scholars say that silver has anti-miasmatic properties and can halt the spread of certain diseases.
Running water supply for noble and common households, for a price.
Responsible for maintaining the supply and quality of the water, from source to city.
Unlocks the §YInspector of the Waters§! minor title
A beautiful carved mural depicting the heroic efforts and the bloody battles that led to the erection of this monument.
New inscriptions that rededicate the arch to yourself and your dynasty.
These statues adorn the top of the arch. They are of a distinctly [Root.Religion.GetName] character.
These statues adorn the top of the arch. They are of a distinctly [Root.Culture.GetName] character.
The surrounding roads are refurbished to a high standard so as to properly serve the bridge and the populace.
Construction and maintenance of a bridge such as this is not a cheap endeavor. Those who wish to cross must pay to do so.
Appointed as the one responsible for the maintenance of the bridge and the safety of those who cross it.
Unlocks the §YMaster of the Crossing§! minor title
Ships must pay a harbour fee, as well taxes on the goods they are transporting.
Specifically placed openings in the underside of the great work that allow hot oil and lethal projectiles to be loosed on attackers.
A massive underwater chain that sits at the bottom of the harbor, waiting to be raised as a blockade in times of war and pestilence.
A covered market hall of a modern design, allowing trade to continue no matter the weather.
An establishment of learned men dedicated to furthering and publishing standard weights and measures, to ensure fair trade for all.
The Bailiff is powerful position, responsible for ensuring the smooth operation of the market, adjudication of trade disputes and the orderly conduct of buyers and sellers.
A hidden hollow, buried deep within the obelisk itself.
This golden capstone glitters in the sunlight and can been seen for miles, like an ever watchful eye.
Spiraling stonework that depicts the suffering of traitors and enemies in increasing brutal fashions.
Responsible for maintaining the supply and quality of the water, from source to city.
Appointed as the one responsible for the maintenance of the bridge and the safety of those who cross it.
The Bailiff is powerful position, responsible for ensuring the smooth operation of the market, adjudication of trade disputes and the orderly conduct of buyers and sellers.
The gigantic statue head was brought back as a trophy when the defenses of [target_wonder.Location.GetName] were razed.
This gleaming capstone is all that remains of the [target_wonder.Location.GetName].
This useful collection of ledgers, contracts, registers and logbooks was recovered from the rubble of the [target_wonder.Location.GetName].
stirred fear in both commoner and noble alike
column3: suscité la peur chez le roturier et le noble
column4: weckte angst im bürgerlichen und im edlen
column6: Despertó miedo tanto en los plebeyos como en los nobles

column2: inspired terror in all those who gaze upon it
column3: terreur inspirée par tous ceux qui la contemplent
column4: terror inspiriert von allen, die darüber nachdenken
column6: terror inspirado en todos los que lo miran
